channel.title: Port already in use
channel.description:
Alright, I know how to fix this problem, but this time it seems a bit different.
Right now I'm at a hotel (Vacation) and I started up a source using this Run.bat [code]@echo off @title [%date%] [%time%]
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\java.exe" -cp ./bin/;./libs/xpp3_min-1.1.4c.jar;./libs/xstream-1.3.1.jar com.rs2.Server localhost 43594 600 pause[/code]
I'm guessing that opened port 43594 on localhost, which is normal, but after I closed it out and tried to start a different source because the first one wasn't the one I wanted and I get the ' Port already in use? ' error, I've restarted my computer and it still didn't fix it, I wen't into the command prompt and looked at all my ports currently open (UDP and TCP) and 43594 doesn't show up under 127.0.0.1, localhost or the hotels Wi-Fi IP address.. I've deleted the port rules for 43594 in the firewall and that didn't seem to work either, but the thing is, if nothing is using port 43594 then what is that's disabling me from running the source because I don't even have uTorrent installed on my computer or ever have.
So if anyone knows what I could try to do to fix this, I'd really appreciate it.
Thanks in advance.
Edit: When I reopen the source that I first used, it works perfectly fine, but any other one isn't working.

item.title: Port already in use
item.dc:creator: @dun_dun_dun dun dun dun
item.description:
@dun_dun_dun wrote:

AtomicInt_:

Open task manager & close the java process.

As I’ve said, when I close down the server (The red [X]) it ends the java.exe and cmd.exe processes in the task manager, so they aren’t there for me to close/end.

lemme_winks_:

to elaborate, make sure nothing else is using the port you want to use. there’s a cmd.exe command that allows you to make a check. just google it.

Nothing else is using the port, trust me, I’ve done netstat -a, netstat -an, netstat -ano and it doesn’t show up under any of the IPs.

Read full topic

item.title: Port already in use

item.title: Port already in use
item.dc:creator: @dun_dun_dun dun dun dun
item.description:
@dun_dun_dun wrote:

Mainly because I’d like to fix this problem right now because if I use 5555 then I’d have to change all my sources to that port, it would be easier to fix the problem.

I got the command prompt to show me the PID of the port, now I just need to find a command in command prompt to close ports which I haven’t been successful with.

Read full topic

item.title: Port already in use
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Why not try another port? Like 5555.

Read full topic

item.title: Port already in use
item.dc:creator: @dun_dun_dun dun dun dun
item.description:
@dun_dun_dun wrote:

Alright, I know how to fix this problem, but this time it seems a bit different.

Right now I’m at a hotel (Vacation) and I started up a source using this Run.bat

[code]@echo off
@title [%date%] [%time%]

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\java.exe” -cp ./bin/;./libs/xpp3_min-1.1.4c.jar;./libs/xstream-1.3.1.jar com.rs2.Server localhost 43594 600
pause[/code]

I’m guessing that opened port 43594 on localhost, which is normal, but after I closed it out and tried to start a different source because the first one wasn’t the one I wanted and I get the ’ Port already in use? ’ error, I’ve restarted my computer and it still didn’t fix it, I wen’t into the command prompt and looked at all my ports currently open (UDP and TCP) and 43594 doesn’t show up under 127.0.0.1, localhost or the hotels Wi-Fi IP address… I’ve deleted the port rules for 43594 in the firewall and that didn’t seem to work either, but the thing is, if nothing is using port 43594 then what is that’s disabling me from running the source because I don’t even have uTorrent installed on my computer or ever have.

So if anyone knows what I could try to do to fix this, I’d really appreciate it.

Thanks in advance.

Edit: When I reopen the source that I first used, it works perfectly fine, but any other one isn’t working.
